alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine in the Rangeley Lakes and Carrabassett Valley region. This includes the following counties, Somerset, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and brooks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 325 PM EDT, Heavy rain associated with thunderstorms will cause small streams and brooks to rise. This could prove hazardous to hikers or recreational visitors to the river valleys. Avoided flooded areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eustis, Rangeley, Kingfield, Bingham, Carrabassett Valley, Phillips, Weld, Dallas Plantation, Byron and Caratunk Plantation.
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
